title: Homebrew
subtitle: A free and open-source package manager makes it easy to install and update applications and utilities.
description:
Must have, Homebrew makes downloading easier.
When you need download something, verify if it is on Homebrew and use brew install xxx.

title: Oh My ZSH
subtitle: A Powerful Terminal
description: Oh My Zsh is a framework to simplify the configuration of the Zsh shell. It allows to add useful feature to the developers with plugins.

title: Neat
subtitle: Neat puts GitHub & Linear notifications in your menu bar
description:
Neat gives developers notification control: mark as unread, pin, and mute.
Only receive notifications for what you truly care about: mentions, review requests, and merges. Built with privacy in mind: all data is stored locally.

title: Rectangle
subtitle: Move and resize windows on macOS with keyboard shortcuts and snap areas
description: Useful when you are multitask with multiple apps at once, you may want to split your view. It's an alternative of Magnet

title: Ngrok
subtitle: One command for an instant, secure URL to your localhost server through any NAT or firewall.
description: Useful to let people test your project without any deployment configuration and is not permanent. By default, at every build, a new random url will be generated.

title: NVM
subtitle: Node Version Manager
description: Easily manage multiple active node.js versions
